basics.name: Kyusun Cho
basics.label: AI Resercher, Integrated MS+PhD Student
basics.summary: 3D Computer Vision Reseracher, Generating and controlling 3D Human Avatars with multi-modal signals

work.name: Queen Mary University of London
work.summary: I am working with Prof. Changejae Oh to develop robotics system with monocular camera inputs.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: GaussianTalker: Real-Time High-Fidelity Talking Head Synthesis with Audio-Driven 3D Gaussian Splatting (ACM Multimedia 2024)
publications.publisher: Kyusun Cho, Joungbin Lee, Heeji Yoon, Yeobin Hong, Jaehoon Ko, Sangjun Ahn, Seungryong Kim
publications.summary: GaussianTalker leverages the fast rendering capabilities of 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) for real-time generation of pose-controllable talking heads.

publications.name: Talk3D: High-Fidelity Talking Portrait Synthesis via Personalized 3D Generative Prior (Arxiv 2024)
publications.publisher: Jaehoon Ko, Kyusun Cho, Joungbin Lee, Heeji Yoon, Sangmin Lee, Sangjun Ahn, Seungryong Kim
publications.summary: Talk3D is a 3D-aware audio-driven talking head synthesis method that can faithfully reconstruct its plausible facial geometries by effectively adopting the pre-trained 3D-aware generative prior.

publications.name: 3D GAN Inversion with Pose Optimization (WACV 2023)
publications.publisher: Jaehoon Ko, Kyusun Cho, Daewon Choi, Kwangrok Ryoo, Seungryong Kim
publications.summary: We introduce a generalizable 3D GAN inversion method that infers camera viewpoint and latent code simultaneously to enable multi-view consistent semantic image editing

references.name: Professor Seungryong Kim
references.reference: My advisor in the Integrated MS+PhD program at Korea University

references.name: Jaehoon Ko
references.reference: Fellow reseracher in the Computer Vision Lab at Korea University

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
